snippet: The refugees flooded the Turkish town of Suruc after their Syrian home came under attack by the Islamic State. But their haven now seems like a purgatory.
abstract: Many refugees who fled majority Kurdish town of Kobani, Syria, as Islamic State advanced have settled in Suruc, Turkey; refugees seem at once luckier and more tortured than masses of displaced people from wars in Syria and Iraq as their homes are still visible from the border, short drive away.
lead_paragraph: The refugees flooded the Turkish town of Suruc after their Syrian home came under attack by the Islamic State. But their haven now seems like a purgatory.

headline.main: For Syrian Kurds, a Refuge in Turkey but Not a Home
headline.print_headline: For Syrian Kurds, a Refuge but Not a Home

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
